channel.title: Elastic Load Balancing on Roman Kurnovskii

item.title: Create Classic Load Balancer
item.description: Practice Creating Classic Load Balancer Planning the Classic Load Balancer When you connected to the AWS account provided in the former step, you had a few things that were already deployed. This is the current infrastructure that was already deployed for you: You already have a VPC with some subnets and 2 EC2 instances running inside the VPC in different Availability Zones. Both instances are inside the same Security Group called , which is allowing HTTP access from port 80 to anywhere (0.
